court: IN IN IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY
judgment_text:
:1:

IN IN IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY

IN IN IN ITS INSOLVENCY JURISDICTION ITS INSOLVENCY JURISDICTION ITS INSOLVENCY JURISDICTION

OFFICIAL OFFICIAL OFFICIAL ASSIGNEE S REPORT DATED 1ST DECEMBER, 2006 ASSIGNEE S REPORT DATED 1ST DECEMBER, 2006 ASSIGNEE S REPORT DATED 1ST DECEMBER, 2006

IN IN IN

INSOLVENCY INSOLVENCY INSOLVENCY NO. 45 OF 1967 NO. 45 OF 1967 NO. 45 OF 1967

Re: Chimanlal B. Brahmabhat

...Insolvent.

....

Mr. Y.C. Parikh, Official Assignee present.

.....

CORAM CORAM CORAM : DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD,J. : DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD,J. : DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD,J.

th th th DECEMBER 2006. DECEMBER 2006. DECEMBER 2006.

P.C. P.C. P.C. : : :

.

An order of adjudication was passed on 12th June

.

The Schedule of Assets and Liabilities was filed by

the Insolvent.

On the basis of the same official Assignee

made

certain

recoveries

in the

estate.

The

Official

Assignee

had

declared pro-rata dividend at the

rate

of

.99

ps.

in

a

rupee

on th

September to

the

Creditors whose claims were admitted by the Official

Assignee.

.

At present, an aggregate amount of Rs.3752.28 ps.

is

lying in the estate as against proved liability of Rs.

,101.17 ps. and unsecured liability of Rs.2,23,015/-.

In the present case, no further recoveries are possible.

.

The Official Assignee has prayed that cash balance

of

Rs.3,752.28

ps.

may be transferred to the

unclaimed

dividend

capital

account

under Rule of

the

Bombay

:2:

Insolvency

Rules, and thereafter to

the

unclaimed

dividend capital revenue account and the account may be

closed for administrative purposes.

.

Having regard to the circumstances set out in the

report

of

the Official Assignee, there is no reason

why

the

prayer

should not be granted.

Prayer clause (a)

of

the report of the Official Assignee is accordingly

granted.

-----
